title: Vice President of India
summary: The Vice President of India (IAST: Bhārat kē Uparāṣṭrapati), officially the Vice President of the Republic of India, is the second-highest constitutional office in India after the President.[2] Article 63 of Indian Constitution states that "There shall be a vice president of India." The vice president acts as president in the absence of the president due to death, resignation, impeachment, or other situations.
